result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Rashard Goodwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin Rashard Goodwin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 17.  Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction with release privileges for Day Reporting Program and 99 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-16 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection - bail to apply.  Court allows defendant to be released for 10 hours for his counsin's funeral.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample;
- bail to apply to costs.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Branch 17 in jury trial on another matter, case spun to Branch 44.
Anonymous letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 661
cf
Received and filed tk

Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Proceeded to plea hearing
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court REITERATES that the defendant is still under the conditions of bail. Court vacated Jury Trial scheduled on 06-24-2015. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Branch 17.

Filed;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Melvin Rashard Goodwin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Melvin Rashard Goodwin in custody.  David Behm for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Exhibits #1 and #2 are marked, offered and received into evidence.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF5345 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibits are ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Melvin Rashard Goodwin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Melvin Rashard Goodwin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
